file_content.text: What you've done on Alderaan will live in history forever.
Lord Serjay Thul.
My friends.
My friend.
Two hours ago, I took the head of one of Organa's generals. The battle was glorious!
You shall be our beloved king.
But only because you held the other front. How high were Killik bodies piled by the time you were through? How many Joiners fell at your feet?
The swarm was endless. So was the bloodshed.
It was exhilarating work.
If only I could have been there.
I don't take pride in killing. Not the enemy, not even insects.
There's no glory in war.
You should. You're good at it.
If you're curious, why don't you face the Killiks, and I'll fight the nobles?
Next time, find out yourself.
Heh. If the opportunity arises, perhaps I will.
You wished to present the message, my lord?
Yes--our ally in the Order of Extermination passed this along.
The Black Hive has crumbled. Their Killiks are in retreat, and collapsing their tunnels should be simple.
I'm sorry I can't say this in person--I'm heading out for aerial reconnaissance--but I want to recognize your efforts.
In the name of the First Huntsman, by the Stone of Chianar, I pronounce you brethren of the order. We will remember you always.
Generous as the sentiment may be, it's time we eliminated her. She knows you, she knows Thul's secrets--and her usefulness is over.
Her reconnaissance mission can end badly. Will you arrange it?
Agreed. Destroy her transport.
Of course. It's a reasonable plan.
I will make contact.
We've worked well together, you and I. When the opposition finally collapses, your support of my kingship would be invaluable.
So long as you obey the Empire, I will give you what you require.
We live to serve the Emperor.
I have given my oath, as you have yours.
Come to me in your time of need, and I will aid you.
You have my support.
My organization knows how to keep people in power. You help us, and we'll help you.
Intelligence can pull strings.
I'd expect nothing less.
I've never been hired by a king. You need something done, let me know.
Credits for support, then.
I will, I promise you.
You're ambitious, but the people won't support a Thul-turned-Sith--and the Empire needs a king who can be controlled.
You'll never become king.
We shall see.
You'll have to live without my "support." This isn't my planet or my cause.
It's not any of my business.
Then our business is done.
That woman is not a threat to you. I want her left alone.
You're not killing anyone.
Why? Why is she even worth the risk?
Imagine what people would say if the Order of Extermination supported your bid for the throne.
Her support could win allies.
A group with no politics, no goals beyond Alderaan's preservation--and they chose House Thul.
It wouldn't sway the houses. But... it might sway the civilian populace.
Many of us still see the order as heroes, my lord.
Very well--she lives, and I am again in your debt.
The Black Hive is dealt with, but there are other nests. And the Order of Extermination is your best hope against them.
The Killiks may still return.
Alderaan's fate tied to those zealots... still, perhaps you're right. We'll keep her under observation.
If you kill her, then you make me your enemy. You can't afford that.
Don't make me lose my temper.
You dare?
Silence!
Chanya Medaal lives. Do not try me again.
I must return to the battlefield, but I wish you well in your travels. What you've seen here on Alderaan... it's only the start for the galaxy.
Face the Killiks, and we will be victorious.
On your knees, all of you. Show respect for the heroes who deposed the false king.
On your knees, all of you. The hero before us deposed the false king.
On your knees, all of you. Show respect for the emissary of Darth Baras.
On your knees, all of you. Show respect for the apprentice of Darth Zash.
I should kill you for what you did to Lady Elana, but we've no time for bad blood.
Agent, step forward. It's not your time to leave Alderaan.
I was told you'd be here, bounty hunter. It's not your time to leave Alderaan.
I am Lord Serjay Thul--apprentice of Darth Viktus and the first of House Thul to survive the Sith Academy.
His lordship will seize the throne you made vacant.
His lordship will have the throne one day.
Fate willing, but my ascension must wait--Alderaan is in a state of anarchy, and a threat greater than the Ulgo usurpers rears its head.
If you are really Sith, then any foe of House Thul is already defeated.
No threat survives a Sith.
None of us are invincible. But we will win, or die.
You'll find my advice and assistance invaluable for a man who would be king.
You seek my aid? How wise.
Do not whisper your poison to his lordship.
Enough! Speak to a Sith that way again and you will lose your skin. I am grateful for all you offer.
What sort of threat? Are we talking about the Republic, or something... local?
Let's review the situation.
Anarchy and threats are my stock in trade. What can I do for you, Lord Thul?
Your crisis is my paycheck.
Lord Thul. I'm honored you would come to me.
It's a pleasure to meet you.
There is no one else I would trust.
Lord Thul. So good to finally talk... why don't we walk, and you can tell me what's wrong.
[Flirt] Pleasure to meet you.
His lordship is a busy man.
Enough--perhaps another time.
You're a would-be Sith and a would-be ruler. You think what threatens you frightens me?
You don't impress me.
His blood is royal, and strong in the Force. What of yours?
We haven't time to bicker.
The Killiks are stirring, legion upon legion. They've already devoured the armies of Qel-Nosh and Antilles.
The people fear it's the Killik Black Hive, returned after a millennium underground. I'm not a superstitious man, but I know disaster when I see it.
I settled our differences with the Killiks in House Cortess. They won't be coming back.
I handled the Killik problem.
Cortess dealt with creatures insignificant next to the Black Hive.
Tell me about this "Black Hive."
The "Black Hive"?
So far, the Killiks have been a distraction. If they're taking out entire armies....
That could change the war.
You see why the Black Hive is different.
Don't tell me House Thul and the Imperial Army can't handle an infestation?
You're afraid of bugs.
No enemy can survive the fury of Empire and Thul together--but the Black Hive is not our only foe.
They're the worst of the Killik broods--the lesser nests fled to the surface to escape being cannibalized by their savage kin.
Yet if his lordship turns his attention to the Killiks, the other houses will destroy Thul.
Moff Sarek and I propose to use small strike teams against the Black Hive, and he advised you take lead.
Succeed, and House Thul can focus on winning the planet. Fail, and Killiks of every size will swarm over Alderaan, and all of us will be Joiners.
I assume your strike teams are in place. Where do I start?
What do you want from me?
I'll send you coordinates for the primary infestation.
If I'm not leading an army, who am I going to lead?
Tell me of the strike teams.
Scientists, Imperial xenocide teams... and another, as well. Chanya Medaal, of the Order of Extermination, has agreed to help us.
I'm afraid you're mistaking me for someone with loyalty to Thul.
Alderaan isn't my planet.
How dare you?
My authority comes from Darth Viktus and Moff Sarek--defy them, and you defy the entire Empire.
We do have one other ally. Chanya Medaal, a member of the Order of Extermination, has agreed to help us.
For twenty millennia, members of the order have forsaken house ties and worldly possessions to protect us from the Killiks.
During the hives' century-sleep, the order watches and prepares; when the hives awake, they spread fire.
They number barely a handful, now. Medaal has no loyalty to Thul, but she's our best hope against these monsters.
The Killiks will be dealt with. Make sure you deal with the other houses.
Leave it to me.
We are partners, then.
From your tone, I take it the order doesn't meet your standards.
You don't like her, do you?
They have a place, and when I am king, they'll be made relevant again.
This isn't my war, and the rest of the galaxy awaits. I make no promises, Thul.
I might help. Or I might not.
Consider the consequences, if Alderaan falls because of you.
Go to Medaal, and listen to her advice--but be careful what you reveal. Remember, she is not one of us.
Be on your way. I have much to do.
